original_title: Designing a Toy Conveyor Belt For Fun and Profit
original_content:
[Hope This Works] wants to someday build a tiny factory line in the garage, with the intent of producing some simple widget down the line. But what is a tiny factory without tiny conveyor belts? Not a very productive one, thats for sure.
As you may have noticed, this is designed after the transporter belts from the game Factorio. [Hope This Works] ultimately wants something functional thats small enough to fit in one hand and has that transporter belt aesthetic going. He also saw this as a way to level up his CAD skills from approximately 1, and as youll see in the comprehensive video after the break, that definitely happened.
And so [Hope This Works] started by designing the all-important sprockets. He found a little eight-toothed number on McMaster-Carr and used the drawing for reference. From there, he designed the rest of the parts around the sprockets, adding a base so that it can sit on the desk or be held in the hand.
For now, this proof-of-concept is hand-cranked. We especially love that [Hope This Works] included a square hole for the crank handle to stand in when not in use. Be sure to check out the design/build video after the break to see it in action.
How happy would you be to see Factorio come up in a job interview?


Thanks for the tip, [foamyguy]!
